info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 5:34PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Riverside County through 615 PM PDT... At 533 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Desert Center. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Winds may also generate blowing dust which could briefly reduce visibilities. Locations impacted include... Desert Center. This includes the following highways... CA Interstate 10 between mile markers 105 and 121. CA Route 177 between mile markers 1 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
